lines.gurmukhi: joeI kulw Drm krm kY sucwr cwr soeI prvwir ibKY sRystu bKwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Joee Kulaa Dharam Karam Kai Souchaar Chaara , Soee Paravaari Bikhai Sraysatu Bakhaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who performs all deeds according to his family traditions, behaves well and kindly is known as an ideal person in the family.

lines.gurmukhi: bnju ibauhwr swco swh snmuK sdw soeI qau bnautw inhkpt kY mwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Banaju Biuhaar Saacho Saah Sanamoukh Sadaa , Soee Tau Banaoutaa Nihakapat Kai Maaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who is honest of all his dealings, alone is considered guileless and sincere before his master, the rich merchant.

lines.gurmukhi: suAwm kwm swvDwn mwnq nrys Awn soeI s√çwim kwrjI pRisiD pihcwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Suaam Kaam Saavadhaan Maanat Narays Aana , Soee Svaami Kaarajee Prasidhi Pahichaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who acknowledges the authority of his king and performs his master's tasks with care and devotion is always recognised as the ideal servant of the master (king).

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys prvys irid AMqir hY sbd suriq soeI isK jg jwnIAY ]380]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Paravays Ridi Antari Hai , Sabad Surati Soee Sikh Jag Jaaneeai ?380?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, an obedient Sikh of the Guru who lodges the teachings of True Guru in his mind and engrosses his consciousness in the divine word is known the world over.  (380)
